section.title: Upload Component
section.para: In this section, you will learn how to configure the Upload service that is defined by the org.exoplatform.upload.UploadService class.
This can be configured with the following XML code:
section.programlisting: <component> <type>org.exoplatform.upload.UploadService</type> <init-params> <value-param> <name>upload.limit.size</name> <description>Maximum size of the file to upload in MB</description> <value>10</value> </value-param> </init-params> </component>
section.para: This code allows uploading files with the default size limit (10MB). The default value unit is in Megabytes.
This limitation will be used by default by all applications if no application-specific limit is set. Setting a different limit for applications is discussed in a later section.
If the value is set to 0, the upload size is unlimited.

step.para: Create an org.exoplatform.webui.form.input.UIUploadInput object type by using one of three following constructors:

listitem.para: The default constructor that allows uploading the file with the size of 10 MB.
listitem.programlisting: public UIUploadInput(String name, String bindingExpression, int limitFile)

listitem.para: This constructor allows you to customize the size limit of uploaded files by using the limitSize parameter. The default value unit is in Megabytes.
listitem.programlisting: public UIUploadInput(String name, String bindingExpression,int limitFile, int limitSize)

listitem.para: This constructor allows you to customize the size limit and the value unit by using the limitSize and unit parameters respectively.
In GateIn, you can set the value unit to Megabytes (MB), Kilobytes (KB) or Gigabytes (GB).
listitem.programlisting: public UIUploadInput(String name, String bindingExpression, int limitFile, int limitSize, UploadUnit unit)

step.para: The following is an example using the third form:
Obtain the limit from the XML configuration by adding the following code to either portlet.xml or portlet-preferences.xml:
step.programlisting: <! The number of files are uploaded --> <preference> <name>uploadFileLimit</name> <value>3</value> <read-only>false</read-only> </preference> <! The size limit --> <preference> <name>uploadFileSizeLimit</name> <value>300</value> <read-only>false</read-only> </preference> <! The unit limit --> <preference> <name>uploadFileLimitUnit</name> <value>KB</value> <read-only>false</read-only> </preference>

note.para: The 0 value means the upload size is unlimited, and the value unit is set to MegaBytes.

listitem.para: Delete the classes used for the upload.
